title: Personalize portfolio for Vedika Pawar and remove template branding

requirements.summary: Replace all placeholder identity content with Vedika Pawar and describe her as a Web Developer with 30 years of experience.
acceptanceCriteria: Home/About hero heading no longer contains “Alex Johnson” and instead shows “Vedika Pawar”.
Home/About subtitle/intro text clearly states “Web Developer” and mentions “30 years of experience” in natural English.
Contact page contact info (email/phone/location) no longer uses alex.johnson@example.com or other Alex placeholders.
No page renders the name “Alex” anywhere in visible text.

file_operations.description: Create a single source of truth for portfolio identity text (name: Vedika Pawar; role: Web Developer; experience: 30 years; contact info) so pages/components can avoid lingering placeholder content.

Replace all Alex Johnson/graduate placeholder hero + about copy with Vedika Pawar identity, explicitly stating she is a Web Developer with 30 years of experience; pull name/role/experience text from frontend/src/content/portfolioIdentity.ts.

Replace placeholder contact information (email/phone/location) with Vedika Pawar contact details sourced from frontend/src/content/portfolioIdentity.ts; ensure no visible 'Alex' remains and keep existing form validation + submission flow intact.

requirements.summary: Remove all caffeine.ai (template/platform) branding from the UI, including the footer link, while keeping a clean self-made footer line.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer no longer contains a link to https://caffeine.ai or the text “caffeine.ai”.
The phrase “Caffeine” / “caffeine.ai” does not appear anywhere in the rendered UI (header, footer, or pages).
Footer still displays a clean, self-made style copyright line without external platform branding.

file_operations.description: Remove the caffeine.ai link/text and replace with a simple self-made copyright line (e.g., © year Vedika Pawar. All rights reserved.) without any external platform branding.

Add a lightweight app-level check (development-only) to help catch accidental leftover 'caffeine'/'caffeine.ai' branding in rendered strings during manual QA, without changing routes or introducing new pages.

requirements.summary: Update header brand text/logo label to Vedika Pawar’s portfolio while keeping existing navigation items and routes unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Header brand text is no longer the generic “Portfolio”.
Navigation still includes Home, Education, Skills, Gallery, Contact and routes continue to work.

file_operations.description: Update the header brand text from 'Portfolio' to 'Vedika Pawar' (or 'Vedika Pawar Portfolio') while preserving existing nav links, labels, and paths; optionally source the brand text from frontend/src/content/portfolioIdentity.ts to keep identity consistent.

requirements.summary: Ensure the portfolio remains a simple, basic PEP Class 10-style multi-page site covering intro, education, skills, gallery, and a working contact form.
acceptanceCriteria: Each of the five pages (Home/About, Education, Skills, Gallery, Contact) remains accessible via navigation.
The Contact form still validates required fields and submits successfully through the existing submission flow.
The overall copy and layout reads as a simple student portfolio (not a platform demo), while keeping all text in English.

file_operations.description: Adjust education page copy to be straightforward and portfolio-focused (education details clearly listed in simple English) without changing the route or removing the education section structure.
Tweak headings/intro text (if needed) to keep the presentation simple and aligned to a student portfolio brief while keeping the existing skills list content and page route intact.
Ensure the gallery page reads as a simple image gallery section (basic English captions); keep existing grid and image usage as-is and avoid introducing new routes/pages.
Confirm contact form remains a working contact form: keep required-field validation and keep submission via the existing useSubmitContactForm flow; limit changes to copy/presentation only.
